Question: Which of the following sequence of documents represents a standard order-to-cash process in SAP S/4HANA?

Option 2: B. Quotation → Inquiry → Sales order → Outbound delivery
Option 3: C. Inquiry → Quotation → Sales order → Outbound delivery

Question: True or False: In the standard cash sales process

Question: True or False: If needed

Question Which of the following are characteristics of the route determination functionality in SAP S/4HANA? (There are three correct answers.) A. The system prompts you to redetermine the route for each item if the ship-to party changes in the order. B. The system prompts you to redetermine the route for each item if the shipping condition changes in the order.
Option 5: C. The system prompts you to redetermine the route for the item if the quantity changes in the order.
Option 6: D. The delivery item category controls whether the route must be redetermined when an outbound delivery is created.
Correct Answer: E. Route determination can be carried out with or without weight group.

Question: True or False: During collective billing
Option 1: different customer reference numbers (field VBKD-BSTKD) in two sales orders always cause a billing document split
Option 2: despite all the other splitrelevant fields having identical values.
Option 3: A. True
Option 4: B. False Correct Answer:B Explanation: False. As mentioned in this chapter
Option 5: the customer reference number is stored in field VBKD-BSTKD in the sales document and field VBRK-BSTNK_VF in the billing document. This field constitutes a special case and does not always cause a billing document split
Option 6: which is the reason why it has not been included in the list of fields that form the standard split criteria shown earlier in Table 11.5. The customer reference number will cause a billing document split only if you maintain the Reference Number parameter with value A in the copy control for billing documents at the header level. But if the Reference Number parameter is blank in the copy control for billing documents
Correct Answer: you can combine two sales documents with two different customer reference numbers (field VBKD-BSTKD) in one billing document since the field VBRK-BSTNK_VF will be blank. Question: Which of the following is the purpose of the simplification list?

Question: Which of the following are simplification items that should be considered when moving to an SAP S/4HANA environment from an SAP ERP 6.0 environment? (There are three correct answers.)
Option 1: A. The SAP ERP SD foreign trade functionality has now been absorbed into the Materials Management (MM) module.
Option 2: B. SD rebates have been replaced by settlement management.
Option 3: C. Output management in SAP S/4HANA Sales is performed
Option 4: by default
Option 5: via BRFplus instead of the previous NAST-based approach.
Option 6: D. The ATP check has been enriched in SAP S/4HANA to include SAP S/4HANA for advanced ATP capabilities.
Correct Answer: E. The standard sales tables VBAK and VBAP do not need to be used anymore in SAP S/4HANA.

Question: Your client asks you why they should implement business partners in their SAP S/4HANA project. Which of the following statements would you mention? (There are three correct answers.)
Option 1: A. Business partners are mandatory in SAP S/4HANA
Option 2: and customers can no longer be created in transactions such as Transaction XD01.
Option 3: B. The business partner approach means we no longer need to think about partner functions such as sold-to party
Option 4: ship-to party
Option 5: bill-to party
Option 6: and payer.
Correct Answer: C. The unified architecture of business partners means one data object can serve multiple roles.
Overall Explanation: D. The business partner approach means that SAP S/4HANA conforms to the same architecture as other SAP products in the landscape.
column10: E. Every SAP user in the system has their own business partner record

Question: Which of the following statements is true about traditional customer master transactions

Option 2: in SAP S/4HANA:
Option 3: A. Attempting to use the transactions will redirect you to Transaction BP.
Option 4: B. Transactions are still available but are not recommended for use.
Option 5: C. Transactions have disappeared entirely and will not be recognized if used. Correct Answer:A Explanation: Obsolete transactions related to customer and vendor master records will now redirect you to the unified Transaction BP via a dialog message. As such
Option 6: the transactions still exist
Correct Answer: but only as a pointer to the correct transaction. Question The CVI functionality can be used to perform which of the following activities? A. Set up the system so that all business partner data is stored in the BUT* tables without the need to copy to tables KNA1 and KNVV B. Ensure that
column10: the data is filtered down to the customer and vendor tables C. Set up a connection between customers and vendors so that any data added to the vendor master data object can be selectively copied to the customer master data object Correct Answer:B Explanation: CVI exists so that there is a permanent link between a business partner and the customer or vendor tables
column11: such as tables KNA1 and LFA1. Once the SAP S/4HANA system is established
column12: business partner data is saved in the BUT* tables
column13: but if the business partner is extended to the role “customer” then the data will be copied to all the customer master tables
column14: such as tables KNA1 and KNVV. Question When converting from SAP ERP 6.0 to SAP S/4HANA
column15: several steps are required in order to convert customers and vendors to business partners. Which of the following steps are required? (There are two correct answers.) A. Implement CVI in your SAP ERP 6.0 system B. Stop all users from creating customers using Transaction XD01 in your SAP ERP 6.0 system using security authorizations C. Convert existing customers and vendors to business partners in your SAP ERP 6.0 system
column16: D. Create a Legacy System Migration Workbench (LSMW) migration script to convert the customers and vendors in your SAP ERP 6.0 system to business partners in your SAP S/4HANA system

Question: Settlement management in SAP S/4HANA replaces SD rebates. What does this mean for the sales data model?
Option 1: A. The SD rebate type field has been extended from 1 character to 3 characters.
Option 2: B. Table VBOX is now redundant.
Option 3: C. Table VBOX can still be used but must be manually activated. Correct Answer:B Explanation: Within the SD rebates functionality
Option 4: table VBOX was a real problem for performance
Option 5: with hundreds of thousands (and in many cases
Option 6: millions) of data records housed in the table. Due to the power of the SAP HANA database
Correct Answer: such index tables are no longer required
Overall Explanation: and table VBOX is therefore completely redundant in SAP S/4HANA. Question The BRFplus approach to outputs does come with a few limitations. Which of these limitations are true? (There are two correct answers.) A. Only business partners can be used for communication purposes. B. IDocs cannot be used at all by BRFplus. C. ALE is not supported by BRFplus.
column10: D. BRFplus is only available for sales outputs
column12: outputs for POs cannot be used.

Question: True or False: The BRFplus approach to SD output management is mandatory in SAP S/4HANA.
Option 1: A. True
Option 2: B. False Correct Answer:B Explanation: False. While it is true that the BRFplus approach to sales and distribution outputs is the default approach in SAP S/4HANA
Option 3: this functionality can be switched off
Option 4: meaning that sales and distribution outputs can revert back to the NAST methodology. Question Which of the following are the attributes of BRFplus decision tables? (There are two correct answers.) A. Multiple condition columns are allowed but only one result column. B. Rows in the decision table are read sequentially from top to bottom.
Option 5: C. When setting up the decision table
Option 6: each step must be activated before it can be used.
Correct Answer: D. Master data value updates in the decision tables in BRFplus must always be transported through the development system to the production landscape.

Question: Which of the following attributes are true for the SAP S/4HANA credit management approach to customer credit limits? (There are three correct answers.)
Option 1: A. Credit limits can be calculated using a predefined and customizable formula.
Option 2: B. Credit limits for customers are maintained using Transaction FD32.
Option 3: C. Customer credit limits can be calculated dynamically or set as a static value.
Option 4: D. Customer credit limits can be activated by sales document type and/or by item category.
Option 5: E. By default
Option 6: customer credit limits are set by the integration with the Credit Rules Engine.

Question: Settlement management has replaced the old SD rebates functionality in SAP S/4HANA
Option 1: and rebates are now more flexible due to some of these changes. Regarding the difference between sales and materials management condition contracts in SAP S/4HANA
Option 2: which of the following statements is true?
Option 3: A. Sales and materials management rebates can now be defined using the same functionality.
Option 4: B. Materials management rebates must now be defined and maintained in SAP Ariba.
Option 5: C. Rebates are processed in SAP Fiori and cannot be maintained in SAP GUI. Correct Answer:A Explanation: The beauty of settlement management in SAP S/4HANA is that it harmonizes both sales and materials management functionality in the same area. As a result
Option 6: condition contracts can be set up in the core system of SAP S/4HANA for customers and vendors alike. SAP Fiori apps are available for creating condition contracts
Correct Answer: as are SAP GUI transactions (Transaction WCOCO). Question Where is the data formerly housed in the SAP ERP SD foreign trade functionality now found? A. Smart business embedded analytics apps in SAP Fiori B. SAP GTS C. SAP Analytics Cloud Correct Answer:B Explanation: The old concept of data in the SAP ERP SD foreign trade functionality is obsolete in SAP S/4HANA. While some of this data has been moved to SAP S/4HANA for international trade
Overall Explanation: the recommended approach for SAP ERP SD foreign trade functions is to use SAP GTS. Question SAP S/4HANA for international trade provides which of the following functions as standard
column10: with no need for any additional licensing? (There are three correct answers.) A. SAP Watch List Screening B. Material classifications
column11: such as commodity codes and intrastat service codes C. License control and embargoes

Question: The sales data model in SAP S/4HANA has been simplified in which of the following ways? (There are two correct answers.)
Option 1: A. Index tables are no longer needed due to the advanced processing power of the SAP HANA database.
Option 2: B. Index tables are no longer in the sales area but have been moved into SAP BTP to optimize performance.
Option 3: C. The status tables VBUK and VBUP have been moved into tables VBAK and VBAP.
Option 4: D. The status tables VBUK and VBUP do not exist in SAP S/4HANA.

Question: The new pricing table PRCD_ELEMENTS has replaced table KONV in SAP S/4HANA
Option 1: thus providing greater flexibility which of the following ways? (There are two correct answers.)
Option 2: A. All pricing master data previously found in the “A” prefixed tables is now found in table PRCD_ELEMENTS.
Option 3: B. Table PRCD_ELEMENTS now allows pricing to be passed freely to the business warehouse without any additional coding required.
Option 4: C. Table PRCD_ELEMENTS is a transparent table rather than a cluster table.
Option 5: D. Field lengths for key fields in the table have been lengthened.

Question: A conversion from SAP ERP 6.0 to SAP S/4HANA requires which of the following steps to be undertaken? (There are three correct answers.)
Option 1: A. During the implementation project
Option 2: customers in the SAP ERP 6.0 system must be set up as business partners using Transaction BP.
Option 3: B. You must use BRFplus as the new output management approach in SAP S/4HANA.
Option 4: C. Any SD rebates must be created in SAP S/4HANA as condition contracts.
Option 5: D. Customers and vendors must be converted to business partners.
Option 6: E. Credit management functionality must be moved to the financial supply chain management model.
